Definition: Cheong fun (or "chee cheong fun") is a popular dish in Singapore and Malaysia. It is a type of Cantonese flat rice noodle rolls, made by steaming a thin layer of rice flour batter then rolled with a filling (usually shrimp, pork or char siew) and served with sweet or savoury sauce such as soy sauce or chili sauce. Cheong fun is often eaten as a breakfast item or as a snack and can also be found at hawker centres or dim sum restaurants in Singapore.
Example: 1. I love having cheong fun for breakfast, it's one of my favorite dishes in Singapore.
